qas.question: At what age were cardinals restricted by Paul Vi from participating in conclaves?
At what age were bishops required to retire by Paul VI?
At what age were cardinals subsequently required to retire in an edict issued in 1970?
What did Paul VI over hall with age and retirement restrictions?
When was Paul Vi's Ecclesiae Sanctae issued?

context: Paul VI revolutionized <a3_0>papal elections<a3_0/> by ordering that only cardinals below the age of <a0_0>eighty<a0_0/> might participate in future conclaves. In Ecclesiae Sanctae, his motu proprio of 6 August <a4_0>1966<a4_0/>, he further invited all bishops to offer their retirement to the pontiff no later than the completion of their <a1_0><a2_0>75<a2_0/><a1_0/>th year of age. This requirement was extended to all Cardinals of the Catholic Church on 21 November 1970. With these two stipulations, the Pope filled several positions with younger bishops and cardinals, and further internationalized the Roman Curia in light of several resignations due to age.
